choices.A: Reduce the auto number prefix to one character
choices.D: Ensure that the prefix setting is read-only
choices.B: Reduce the auto number prefix to two characters
choices.C: Reduce the suffix length to four characters

questions.question_text:
You work for a company using Dynamics 365 for Sales.
When customers call the company, they must provide their quote number. Customers report that quote numbers are too long.
You need to shorten quote numbers to the minimum possible length.
What should you do?

discussion.content: This is the same question as Question # 8.
Correct answer is A

Selected Answer: A
corretto

Selected Answer: A
correct

Even if you ignore the fact that changing the length of suffix will be applicable to all entities:
if you change Suffix length to 4, then total length would be 14 chars (QUO-01001-AS7F)
and If you change prefix to 1 char, then total length would be 13 chars (Q-01001-AS7FX) {assuming the suffix length stays 5 char which is default length) 

So correct answer should be "A. Reduce the auto number prefix to one character"

In Dynamics 365 for Sales, the quote numbers are automatically generated using the Auto Number feature. To shorten the quote numbers, you can reduce the Auto Number Prefix to one or two characters, depending on the total number of quotes that are expected to be created.

Therefore, the correct answer is either A. Reduce the auto number prefix to one character or B. Reduce the auto number prefix to two characters.

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

If you change the suffix, it applies to all entities. But, if you change prefix, it applies to the concerned entity only. Since, customers are complaining about quotes only, we need to reduce the prefix only.
The answer is correct. The minimum character for Prefix is 1 and the max is 3

Actually default length of prefix is 3 like QUO for quote. Default suffix is between 4 to 6, don't remember OOB value. Let's take 6 as default, why not. Reducing 6 to 4 and 3 to 1 gives same result. So A and C may be correct as well. 
Hard to believe that both answers will be correct. We do not know how full number looks now. Was it changed earlier? 
I'd go with reducing prefix as much as possible.
correct answer is A - you can change the Prefix, not the suffix
The correct answer is C
B is answer

comments.content: It's wrong, the answer B is similar to A without one letter. The correct answer is C
Wouldn't it be A. If you reduce the suffix length to 4 characters it reduces it for all entities. The question specifically says to reduce the length for quotes?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is:
C. Reduce the suffix length to four characters
correct!

comments.content:
There is a similar question: When customers call the company, they must provide their quote number. Customers report that quote numbers are too long.
You need to shorten quote numbers to the minimum possible length.
What should you do?
A. Change the field type from auto number to decimal number
B. Reduce the auto number prefix to one character 
C. Reduce the suffix length to four characters
D. Ensure that the prefix setting is read-only

The point is to reduce the PREFIX as much as possible. So it is correct.

discussion.content: For the first question, the answer is Add a custom field to store the time, we need a filed to show in Qualify stage and not a report

comments.content: If create Process Flow, as an example I used the Opportunity Sales Process, it is possible to add Stage, Conditional, Data Step, Workflow, Action Step, and Flow Step.7 Data Steps are used for the Qualify stage

discussion.content: For question two, the Propose stage becomes inactive, and the Develop sage becomes active. Tried and tested.
On exam 14 dec 23
1b 2a corretto
1b 2a correct

If the stage specific duration is not being captured at all, how can only creating a fetchxml based report can help. Either you create a report or a view, it will require a custom field to store duration for the stage and changes in Flow/workflow etc to calculate the duration.

In my solution to a customer, I would capture entry and exit time for each stage and a calculated field to capture duration for stage.
Sorry, correct answers: 3 & 1
Correct answers: 4 & 1
On exam March 2022

I think its correct. 1. You create a fetchxml because adding custom field later does not show you anything on past records. Also, its a half solution- how will it calculate time?
2. Is correct because thats how it works if used correctly.
for the 2nd questions, both stages remain active as long as I don't click on "Set active" on the stage I'm returning to. So I wonder what does MS consider as correct...
On exam
I can't imagine XML report that shows that time, but actually at work I've created a custom entity with fields to store BPF stage durations and it worked well.
after adding the field, the easiest way to get your answer is to fetch a report using the field isn't it?

I think the answer is:
Add a custom field to store the time
The Process stage becomes inactive and the Develop stage becomes active
I believe the duration of a single stage is not saved anywhere, like the duration for the entire process is. So reporting it is not possible before you store the update date or duration somewhere.

As MS advises, it always better to stick with the standard solutions.
I think when they elaborate the questions, they do not think about personalized/particular custom development style, as we developers do. So I think Fetch Report is the most accurate answer
Custom Field for the first part - https://nakedcrm.wordpress.com/2017/06/06/how-can-i-work-out-the-time-spent-in-each-stage-of-a-business-process/
I'm not sure about the answer to the 2nd question, because I can update a field in a previous stage without making it active.

comments.content: I think based on the options available, it's the first option and assumes you'd follow the correct process when using BPF
If click Back on the Propose stage on the Business Process Workflow, the Propose stage becomes inactive, and the Develop stage becomes Active

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Sales administrator.
You create the following flow.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that answers each question based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT -
You have a dashboard that shows the number of completed calls and cancelled calls in a chart. Sales Representatives mark completed calls by using one of the following values: Wrong Number, Left Message, or Connected.
You need to update the dashboard to display wrong phone numbers.
How should you make the modification? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I guess the answer is correct here, given the fact of tricky wording... They are not asking to update the chart or to create a new chart, they're talking about "update a dashboard" and it looks to me that I just have to filter the chart on the dashboard using that field and that's it.

comments.content: It says that the chart shows "completed" and "cancelled" (state), not the reasons (status reason) why they are completed or cancelled. So I think the first answer should be "Alter the chart", because you need to add status reason field to it

discussion.content: Correct answer: Create a NEW chart, where the field is Status Reason (current chart is using Status field).
1a-2b correct
2b correct
1a correct (don't talk about chart, only dashboard, so filters...)

Feel it should be 1. Alter existing dashboard and 2. use Status Reason.

Asking to update the dashboard...not create new.
In exam...

comments.content: I guess you use a filter to perform this UPDATE. It says you have to display (only) wrong numbers, altering the chart will not help, as you need to put a filter on the view which is used in the chart.. Or am i mistaking?

discussion.content: I think he first answer is "Alter the existing chart..." the request is: You need to UPDATE the dashboard to display wrong phone numbers.

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company plans to move their headquarters from the United States to Europe.
You need to round all currency values to four decimal places and display the correct currency symbol.
Solution: Change the currency decimal precision and currency display options.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
yes, agreed the answer is A. See image in currency setup section, both are Currency precision and Currency symbol are system level setups when configuring a currency in Dynamics 365: https://neilparkhurst.com/2019/02/25/mb-210-microsoft-dynamics-365-for-sales-currencies
also, in Microsoft docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/manage-transactions-with-multiple-currencies
A is correct answer

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
corretto
correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct
Answer is A. That's how to do it.

comments.content: The question is not about changing base currency. It is about precision and display. So the anwser is correct.

discussion.content: The answer is No. If a company moves its HQ to Europe, it will wish to change its Base Currency to EUR. Base Currency cannot be deleted and cannot be changed. CRM must be reinstalled.
A is right
The Answer is correct. Under power platform admin, currency setting, you can select both symbol and precision
the answer si YES

Answer is YES I've just tested : My default currency is euro, so I went in >> System >> Business Management>> Currencies I selected "Euro" and I changed the symbol by $ instead of €, then I went to my personnal settings to be sure the Euro was selected as my default currency and in the lookup it was "Euro, EUR, $". then I created a new opportunity record,and the currency was the Euro (the one I had chosen) but when I added products the price was 10$ and not 10€. So to my surprise it worked..
Answer is Yes.The base currency cannot be deleted and cannot be changed. Although you can revise some details such as precision, display name and symbol.

comments.content: Then shouldn't the answer be No? The solution option was currency precision and currency display options. Not currency precision and currency symbol
Agree with jit55. The answer is yes, i have just completed this exercise in a Trial version of D365 Sales

Currency display options is in System Settings > General and it allows you to choose to display the currencies using either Currency symbol or Currency code - this does not mean you are changing the symbol or "displaying the correct currency symbol" as the question asks

discussion.content:
In configuration we can edit symbol and precision even for base currency.
But this isn't going to affect the prescision of any existing data but new one.
For me the question is ambigious and i would
respond No if i consider existing data
Yes for i consider new one.
Answer is correct
Yes , both currency precision and currency symbol can be changed
The answer is A tested
The answer is yes because you can change both in system settings

The answer is NO, because Opportunities in course with quotes are not changed in cascade.
Besides the currency precision is not necesary the same of the field.
the answer is No because the currency symbol is not edited by Currency Precision
